description: Advanced senior-level biology focusing on biochemistry, cellular energetics, molecular genetics, gene regulation, human physiology, biotechnology, ecology, environmental biology, and evolutionary relationships. Designed to prepare students for university-level biology and AP/IB courses.

topics.name: Unit 1: Advanced Biochemistry & Protein Function
topics.description: Biochemical energetics, thermodynamics in biological systems, protein folding mechanisms, enzyme regulation, allosteric control, metabolic pathways, signal peptides, protein targeting, and interactions between macromolecules

topics.name: Unit 2: Cellular Respiration – Detailed Mechanisms
topics.description: Aerobic respiration pathways, glycolysis regulation, pyruvate oxidation, Krebs cycle enzyme-level control, oxidative phosphorylation, chemiosmosis, electron transport chain dynamics, ATP yield calculations, and anaerobic pathways

topics.name: Unit 3: Photosynthesis – Detailed Mechanisms
topics.description: Light-harvesting complexes, photosystems I and II, photolysis, electron transport in chloroplasts, Calvin cycle regulation, C3 vs C4 vs CAM pathways, photorespiration, and environmental influences on photosynthetic efficiency

topics.name: Unit 4: Molecular Genetics & Gene Regulation
topics.description: Chromatin structure, epigenetic regulation, transcriptional and post-transcriptional control, RNA interference, operons, enhancers and silencers, regulatory proteins, mutations, genome organization, and genetic variation mechanisms

topics.name: Unit 5: Advanced Human Physiology & Control Systems
topics.description: Neurophysiology, synaptic transmission, endocrine regulation, hormone cascades, cardiovascular and respiratory integration, renal filtration and osmoregulation, immune system coordination, and systems-level homeostasis

topics.name: Unit 6: Biotechnology & Genetic Engineering
topics.description: Recombinant DNA technology, gene cloning, CRISPR–Cas systems, genome editing techniques, PCR advances, sequencing technologies, synthetic biology, gene therapy, cloning ethics, and biotechnology applications in medicine and agriculture

topics.name: Unit 7: Environmental Biology & Bioethics
topics.description: Pollution biology, climate change effects, ecosystem disruptions, conservation strategies, human environmental impact, sustainable development, ethical considerations in biotechnology, medical ethics, and environmental policy

topics.name: Unit 8: Advanced Ecology
topics.description: Population modeling, carrying capacity, ecological succession, biogeochemical cycles in depth, ecosystem energetics, species interactions, community structure, biodiversity metrics, and ecological resilience

topics.name: Unit 9: Evolution & Phylogenetics
topics.description: Evolutionary mechanisms, Hardy–Weinberg analysis, molecular evolution, phylogenetic trees, cladistics, comparative genomics, speciation models, evolutionary relationships, and evidence from fossils, DNA, and morphology
